item.title: Admin
item.description:
Power corners

4 corners of power

  • TTD secular wing, the EO , and the temple specific incharge JEO
  • vaikhanasa archakas , the 4 families, and the sthanacharya ( a trained vaikhanasa scholar, not necessarily from the 4 families).
    • the vaikahanasa archakas in Tirumala are allied with vadakalai, as they have strong connectiosn to ahobilam matham.
  • ananthalwar/ Ananthanpillai and tatacharya system
  • the pedda and chinna jeeyars (tenkalai).
    • the Tirumala matham doesn’t have many followers. its main claim is the ability to get darshanam for its people, and thats what generates money for them. and the annual donation from ttd
    • they have control over sattumorai seva . every day early morning this seva happens, where only sri vaishnavas are allowed. there is no que , no ticket. and direct entry into the temple without any wait time at all . also allowed to go very near the lord.

the only 4 trustees of temples are Ananthanpillai family, Tatacharya family and the two jiyars

item.title: Archakas
item.description:
Current rotation

Illustrious Gollapalli family - go back almost 50 generations in the service of the lord.

Gollapalli (bhAradvAja), paidipalli, peddinti, Tirupatamma , 4 families. All 4 families are tight. Right now over 80 people are there, male descendants of these 4 families.

They do marry often only among themselves. It seems one of the gotras there got asoucham due to a death. so half the staff ineligible. So double duties for these remaining archakas.

item.title: MAnasa on books
item.description:
Overview

There are 6 books primarily written on the temple, published by TTD.

  • 3 books have false information due to the authors being biased towards smartha /shaiva sects
  • 3 are vaishnava aligned.
    • of them , 1 is written by a disciple of kanchi kamakoti peetham, but he strongly disavows the shaiva viewpoint. He is Dr N Ramesan. Dr N ramesan, was a phd in archeology, and also an IAS. He was the executive officer of TTD, and later the chairman of TTD. Even though it’s not the best book info wise, it is important because of him adhering to the truth and not succumbing to his matham’s theology.
    • 1 is by a sri vaishnava, so vaishnava aligned .(TKT Veeraraghavacharya )
    • 1 is by a madhva , but its considered the most authoritative book , above all. (Prof SKR rao)

Sadly, people who have intimate knowledge if the temple, have written false information.

item.title: Not shiva
item.description:
As far as i know , based on every book i have read, and what i saw with my own eyes a few months ago , from just outside the Kulasekhara paDi ( the last threshold) , i can say these things.

NO NAGABHARANAS

There ARE NO NAGABHARANAS etched on the murthy. There are armlets, which have vertical spires , called saptaagni shikha on the arms .
(The nagabharaNas commonly seen are merely external ornaments.)

item.title: Photo access
item.description:
There is an outer perimeter , which has a silver lined doorway leading to the inner part of the temple ( Vendi Vakili or silver corridor) .

This leads to the inner temple, which is gilded over by gold ( Bangaru vimanam). The inner temple has a courtyard called Tirumaamani mandapam, or Mahamani mandapam, which is gilded all over by gold plates. This courtyard has Garudalwar, and the 2 dwarapalakas ( Jaya and Vijaya ) , and the Main bell, and Hundi of the temple.

item.title: Ritual compromises
item.description:
rAmAnuja installation

originally, there was only a metal idol of Ramanuja, consecrated in his lifetime, by himself when he last visited Tirumala. the stone idol came almost 200 years later.

The vaikhanasa archakas objected to stone idol of him, as the metal was deemed sufficient. Tirumala is a eka bera archana temple, with some unique practices.

But the sri vaishnavas moved an idol of Parthasarathy from that spot and instead put bhasyakara stone image there .

item.title: SevAs
item.description:
Scale

the Tirumala temple has more pilgrims than mecca or Jerusalem… it is the most visited religious shrine on planet earth. yet it is not having the same kind of limelight as those. 34 million visitrors annually.

sattumorai

Qualification - shikha and wear the traditional dress, and urdhvapundram.

just go near the temple main gate at 3-3:30 am and stand. others in similar garb will show up. there is no ticket , and no advertisement or anything for this .

item.title: TTD service
item.description:
so the scale of Tirumala is beyond any other temple. …. its a supertemple, and the true beating heart of Hinduism . not even ayodhya, kasi, srirangam, or any other teertha kshetra come even close to it in terms of scale of operations

Education and research

currently TTD runs

  1. sri venkateswara university
  2. padmavathi mahila university
  3. venkateswara university of medical sciences - upto superspecialty level
  4. venkateswara Vedic university - the largest and oldest current Vedic university in the world venkateswara Vedic university , teaches all 4 vedas, in multiple shakas, and 4 agama schools also . each student is given a fixed deposit of 4 lakhs currently, which they get upon their graduation . the education, lodging is completely free. currently 350 students are there. but 5-6 years ago, there were 1500 students. the previous Christian govt of AP reduced intake.
  5. venkateswara zoological park and animal welfare center
  6. venkateswara horticultural institute
  7. venkateswara college of arts and sciences
  8. venkateswara institute of Shilpa shastra
  9. venkateswara music college

and another 3 more institutes, all of which are funded by the temple.

item.title: Wealth
item.description:
Assets

They have US dollars in cash , exceeding 100 million.
55 tons of gold in their vaults ( not his jewellery, just smelted gold ).
TTD owns 30,000 acres of land throughout india.
on any given day, the lord wears 350 kg of gold ornaments on him.

Revenue

Tirumala temple generates more money than the entireity of all temples in south india combined. Just last year (2024), the main hundi ( only one hundi, only cash ) generated was 1543 crores .

item.title: पालकादयः
item.description:
क्षेत्रपालो रुद्रः

Rudra is the kshetrapalaka of Tirumala. this is authentic. every year, on shiva ratri, the archakas go to a shila 1 km away from the temple, and do rudrabhisekham there to it.

They have a tradition of touching the keys to the kshetrapalaka shila (of which a piece is there in the temple near the dhvajastambham ) with keys of sanctum both while entering and leaving.

देवतान्तर-पात्राणि

यन्त्रपालकाः - दुर्गा, क्षेत्रपालः, गणपतिः, त(ट?)ण्डु-भैरवः।
